data.description: Exploration of core problems of political life, such as the nature and limits of obligation, the concept of justice and its political implications, and the relationship between equality and liberty, through a selection of ancient and modern sources. Not open to students with credit for POLI SCI 209 prior to fall 2017
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO POLITICAL THEORY

data.description: Exploration of key themes, developments, and figures in Christian political and ethical traditions.
data.title: CHRISTIAN POLITICAL THOUGHT

data.description: The development of Western political, economic and social thought, from its origins in classic Greece and the Judaeo-Christian tradition, through Rome and the Medieval period, to the Renaissance and Reformation.
data.title: WESTERN CULTURE: POLITICAL, ECONOMIC, AND SOCIAL THOUGHT I
